responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: "Insecure use of shell commands with untrusted input in scripts/run-queued-jobs.sh"
    analysis: |
      The script directly embeds unfiltered input into a shell command that executes potentially hazardous operations. This input is derived from the file names in the SILVERSTRIPE_CACHE directory which might be manipulated by an attacker. Using such untrusted input directly within a shell command elevates the risk of command injection. This risk is pronounced if an attacker can influence or control the filenames in the specified directory which are then used dynamically in command execution contexts without proper sanitation.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - "scripts/run-queued-jobs.sh"
    classification: "very promising"
```

leads.headline: Insecure use of shell commands with untrusted input in scripts/run-queued-jobs.sh
